lexUnit.name: seize.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: take hold of suddenly and forcibly.

sentence.text: For skin rolling , seize the flesh between thumb and forefinger and lift it away from the bone .
Then one of the men gave a shout , seized the boy by a leg and pulled him into the hall .
Cranston seized the bowl by its two silver handles and half drained it at a gulp .
Lieutenant Calley seized it by one leg , flung it back into the ditch and shot it .
She 'd seized her friend excitedly by the arm .
She tried to embrace him , but he seized her by the arms and shook her till her teeth chattered .
A hand seized him by the hair and yanked his head back .
He seized Brückner by the jacket of his pyjamas .
At one stage , one seized him by the neck and nearly chocked him .
Dr Neil stepped back so swiftly that she almost fell ; he seized her by the shoulders and held her from him .
Benedict seized her by the shoulders in an ungentle grip .
Mr Blakey seized the dogs by their collars .
But as she seized it in her hand , before her horrified eyes the dried petals fell away and fluttered to the floor , scattering like confetti at her feet .
Corbett pushed the meat through and watched the leading dog seize it in his huge jaws , throwing it up and devouring it , the blood streaming down his black , slavering mouth .
Then Bully seized the rope in his teeth and began to pull against her .
He suddenly seized her under the armpits and swung her round and round , until she was breathless .
With a sudden swift movement , he seized the shotgun with his left hand and sent it whirling off into the night after the pistol .
He seized her left hand across the table .
The dream-man called Duvall seized Jimmy around the neck in a way which was surely too painful to be a dream and yanked him to his feet , throwing him on to a desk .
A pair of powerful arms seized me from behind , jerking me upright and off my feet .
The men in the smithy seized him ; and one of them took a hammer and drove a nail into the sole of his boot .
Then they seized him , shouting in a strange tongue .
Mr Beckenham seized her shoulders .
I was near St Anthony 's Hospital , between Bishopsgate and Bread Street , intent on lifting a purse , when my arm was suddenly seized : it was the goldsmith , Waller , demanding his money .
He seized Bragg 's elbow .
Vivien went up to him and said " Oh , Tom " ; he seized her hand and said " How do you do " in a loud voice .
